data.question: The sum of the interior angles of a polygon is 20 right angles. How many sides does the polygon have?
data.solution:
The formula for the sum of the interior angles of a regular polygon = (2n - 4) x 90°

Given: Sum = 20 right angles

(2n - 4) x 90° = 20 times 90°

⇒ 2n - 4 = 20

2n = 24; n = 12.

data.question:
Solve the equations
m<sup>2</sup> + n<sup>2</sup> = 29
m + n = 7
data.solution:
m<sup>2</sup> + n<sup>2</sup> = 29 .......(1)
m + n = 7 ............(2)

From (2),
m = 7 - n
but m<sup>2</sup> + n<sup>2</sup> = 29, substituting;
(7-n)<sup>2</sup> + n<sup>2</sup> = 29
49 - 14n + n<sup>2</sup> + n<sup>2</sup> = 29
=> 2n<sup>2</sup> -14n + 20 = 0
Thus n<sup>2</sup> -7n + 10 = 0

Factorizing;
(n-5)(n-2) = 0
n - 5 = 0, => n = 5
n - 2 = 0, => n = 2.

When n = 5,
m + n = 7, => m = 2,

When n = 2,
m + n = 7, => m = 5.

Thus (m,n) = (5,2) and (2,5)

From Pythagoras theorem

|OA|2 = |AN|2 + |ON|2

72 = |AN|2 + (5)2

|AN| = √24


= √4 x 6


= 2√6 cm

|AN| = |NB| (A line drawn from the centre of a circle to a chord, divides the chord into two equal parts)

|AN| + |NB| = |AB|

2√6 + 2√6 = |AB|

|AB| = 4√6 cm
